Dear Mr. Bill Gates First of all, I would like to thank you, your wife and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for all of your contributions for humanity. You and your wife are role models for many people around the world. Today, I am writing to you as a citizen of my home country, Vietnam, who finds the use of the illegal Nine-Dash Line in your public presentation deeply concerning. The source of my concern is your talk entitled â€œLiving in extreme povertyâ€ published on Youtube on October 31, 2018, which includes the â€œNine-Dash Line,â€ a disputed naval boundary claimed by China. Please see a screenshot of the video at 2:40 attached. The Nine-Dash Line is an illegal demarcation line used by the Chinese government to claim a major part of the South China Sea, including islands to which China and neighboring countries, including Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, and Vietnam, have made conflicting claims. These islands include the Paracel Islands, the Spratly Islands, Pratas Islands, Macclesfield Bank, and the Scarborough Shoal. In July 2016, an arbitral tribunal constituted under Annex VII to the 1982 United Nations convention on Law of the Sea ruled that China has no legal basis to claim the Nine-Dash Line. Opting to exacerbate tensions rather than respect this decision, the Chinese government has spent the past several years militarizing the region. This has led to the killing and detention of Vietnamese fishermen operating in the South China Sea. Recently, your talk has been shared among the Vietnamese community and the appearance of the Nine-Dash Line has made many people upset, because this touched on the issue of national sovereignty of almost 100 million Vietnamese and many people from other countries in the region. I understand that you might not be aware that the Chinese government has been inserting the Nine-Dash Line in countless documents to try to assert their illegal claim in the mind of people who are unfamiliar with the dispute. It is my strong opinion that the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation is an inappropriate forum for the underhanded advancement of political agendas. I am kindly asking that you and your colleagues at the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to consider amending the neutral policy of the foundation to exclude maps with controversial borders as deemed necessary in any media materials and documents. It is my belief that this is a necessary step to preserve the standing of philanthropy such as yours as a neutral medium purely for the charitable activities. Thank you for your consideration.
